Mangroves are intertidal estuarine wetlands ecosystem along the tropical and subtropical coasts, covering approximately 60 to 75% of the global coastline
1 . Mangrove ecosystems serve a variety of important ecological and economic functions, including protecting coastlines from storm damage and erosion, degrading environmental contaminants, and providing nursery habitats for numerous aquatic organisms
